docs.text: the sheer horrific audacity of the nazi plan to exterminate the jews of europe is almost incomprehensible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: people may make documentaries about it for another hundred years and still not understand the organized , methodical hatred .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: five concentration camp survivors from the last days of world war ii tell their stories in the last days , the first documentary from steven spielberg's survivors of the shoah visual history foundation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the five interviewees are linked by their hungarian ancestry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the introduction explains , even as germany started to lose the war , the nazis stepped up their extermination of the jews in europe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in 1944 , hungary had the last big population of jews within germany's reach , and they became the last target of hitler's " final solution . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: each of the five tells his or her story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: their stories are intercut chronologically , starting from normal life in pre-war hungary .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they recall the nazi invasion of hungary , being sent to " work " camps and their realization that they were actually in death camps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they recall their horrible , precarious lives in auschwitz and buchenwald ; the deaths of their family and friends ; their loss of hope .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: each recalls his or her unfathomable , eventual liberation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and finally , the last days shows their cathartic , pained , modern-day return to their old homes and the camps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: needless to say , their stories are horrifying , amazing , and emotionally draining .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: by themselves , the stories would be forceful testaments , but by cutting them in parallel , their impact is multiplied by five .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the last days is a talking-heads style documentary -- it's mostly pictures of people telling their stories , intercut with period photographs and newsreel footage .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in this kind of movie it's almost impossible to get archival pictures from the same time and place being discussed on-screen , but director james moll made a better effort than most at finding specific , or at least relevant , images to go with his subjects' narration .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the liner notes ( one of the many nice features of this dvd ) indicate that there is some never-before-seen historical footage in the last days .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not clear which scene it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it could be one of two that i hadn't seen before , both powerful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one is rare color footage , shot by an american , of piles of victims in cattle cars .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is something jarring , something unsettling about seeing the pictures in color , when so much of the footage from world war ii is in black and white .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another segment shows walking skeletons ; survivors who are so starved that they hardly look human anymore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there has been a glut of holocaust movies and i was skeptical that a new documentary would have anything new to say .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but by focusing on hungarian jews during the last days of the war , moll told a specific part of the story in a new way , in greater detail .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and i'm glad he did because his careful filmmaking stands up well compared to other movies on the same subject .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the transfer to dvd is rich and beautiful .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: x-mozilla-status : 0009f words for a holocaust documentary , but some of the interviews take place in europe in late spring , when skies are blue and trees are green .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , the movie was shot on 35mm film ( and not video ! ) ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so the richness and detail are impeccable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dvd's features are plentiful and well-chosen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a theatrical trailer for the movie , which is a great introduction to the subject matter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are about fifty still photos , both from the production crew and from the private collections of the survivors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , the disc has two complete versions of the movie ( widescreen and full screen ) , both on the same side .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the more interesting dvd features is an outtake segment for each of the survivors ( plus one for the crew ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you'd think outtakes would be inappropriate in a holocaust documentary , but they're not bloopers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead , they are solid , moving segments that were probably cut from the film only for length .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of them continues a confrontation that was only touched on lightly in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: renee firestone ( one of the five ) spoke on camera with dr . hans m ? nch , a german doctor who ran the medical clinic at auschwitz .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: firestone was aggressive , questioning the doctor about what his children thought .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the doctor was evasive and clearly uncomfortable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another of the outtakes showed bill basch saying a prayer for his dead friends at auschwitz .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he ends his prayer by saying " . . . forgive me for surviving . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's ambitious to shoot a documentary on 35mm film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's ambitious to make it on a subject that has saturated cable , television , and movies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's ambitious to make it 54 years after the events it covers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the last days handles all these potential obstacles very well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's only fitting that the dvd , with its wealth of interesting and relevant features , would also be ambitious and successful .
docs.label: positive
